title.narrative: Water Stewardship in Agriculture: Transforming Sugarcane Sector for Efficient & Sustainable Production in India

description.narrative: In 2020 in India we have reached out to 150,000 small scale sugarcane farmers, their 337,500 workers, and brought 176,560 hectares of land under sustainable practices. We used extensively our digital tool ‘Indian Sustainable Sugar Smallholders Framework’ (I3SF) for training and information dissemination purposes. Small videos in the form of learning materials have also been made and uploaded on I3SF platform to make it a knowledge platform. During 2020, the Sugarcane team has been able to develop a tool esugarcanebook.com. This tool supports farmers to digitize their practices. Initially, 3 villages were selected to pilot this tool. In 202, we plan to cover 7,500 farmers with the help of this tool. This tool will further be linked to our I3S Framework. Through different non-digital methods 3,564 women farmers were trained on issues like sugarcane seedling growing in nurseries, sugarcane farming, financial literacy, occupational health and safety. In Uttar Pradesh 14 women’s self help groups (SHGs) were supported to manage nurseries of new varieties. In a time span of three months this gave 339 women around INR 1750 per person as extra income. We supported 210 agricultural service providers to provide better agri and administrative services to an estimated 63,000 farmers. In partnership with VSI Pune and University of Agricultural Sciences Dharwad the programme helped saving 339 billion liters of water.
